div1.p: Copy Company "G" Fort Shaw, M.E. November 12th 1886
To the Secretary of the American Legation Brussels Belgium.

I am at present a Sergeant in the army of the United States and my term of service expires February 19, 1887 when I am thinking of making application for a position in the service of the Congo Free State.

I shall consider myself greatly indebted to you, if you will kindly furnish me information, how to proceed, and when I shall have to go, to make application. I have been given to misunderstand, that the Congo State is governed from Brussels with His Majesty the King of Belgium as President; that is my motive in

writing to you for the information desired. I expectto be in Brussels four months from this date, and if I am posted, it will save me time and trouble and money. I need only add, that I speak english and german, have served in the german Field artillery at Danzig from 74-78 have visited the Ordnonce school at Berlin from 76-77 and shall have a first class discharge and the best of references from my present superior officers
Hoping for your kind assistance. I am Sit Your obedient servant Gustav Lobel Sergeant Co. "G" 3rd Infantry Fort Shaw, M.J
